name: ADC
description: Therapeutic agent that combines a monoclonal antibody with a cytotoxic drug via a chemical linker, allowing targeted delivery of the cytotoxic drug to cancer cells.

name: mAb
description: Laboratory-made proteins that mimic the immune system's ability to fight off harmful pathogens such as bacteria and viruses.

name: Cell Therapy
description: Treatment that uses whole cells or cell-derived products to cure or alleviate disease, including CAR-T, TCR, and other engineered cell therapies.

name: Small Molecule
description: Low molecular weight organic compounds that can regulate biological processes with potential therapeutic benefits.

name: mRNA
description: Genetic material that contains instructions for cells to make specific proteins that can fight or prevent disease.

name: Peptide
description: Short chains of amino acids that can function as drugs, often targeting specific molecular pathways or receptors.

name: Gene Therapy
description: A technique that uses genes to treat or prevent disease by replacing a mutated gene, introducing a new gene, or deactivating a problematic gene.

name: RNAi
description: Biological process in which RNA molecules inhibit gene expression or translation by neutralizing targeted mRNA molecules.
